oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Church of the Lord Jesus service, 1999 September 25
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service with few attendees. Music and singing open the service. Eileen, Dewey Chafin, and Lydia Hollins play as members sing. Bob Elkins interposes hands on a child in the congregation as the music continues. Members begin to handle serpents as the music continues. When the music pauses, Roy “Bootie” Christian gives thanks and testifies. This opens the floor for several other members of the congregation to give testimony. Bob Elkins gives a sermon with the aid of several fellow preachers after the testimony ends. When the sermon ends, members begin handling serpents as music and dancing once again fill the church. The recording ends with the continued testimony of various members of the congregation, and a prayer.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern -- Religious life and customs; Dance -- Religious aspects; Expository preaching; Extemporaneous preaching; Imposition of hands; Lay preaching; Pentecostal preaching; Singing -- Religious aspects; Snake cults (Holiness churches) -- Appalachian Region, Southern; Witness bearing (Christianity)
Chafin, Dewey; Christian, Roy; Elkins, Bob; Evans, Melissa; Evans, Richard; Hollins, Lydia; Jewel, Buddy; Jewel, Ruby; McAllister, Ray; McCoy, Tim
Church of the Lord Jesus (Jolo, W. Va.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Church of the Lord Jesus recordings and photographs
Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
